summary: The Forage Fish Conservation Act of 2025 aims to improve the management of forage fish, crucial for marine ecosystem health. It directs the Secretary of Commerce to define 'forage fish,' considering their role in the food web. The bill amends the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, requiring scientific advice on forage fish populations, establishing guidelines for Councils, and mandating fishery management plans include assessing catch limits based on the dietary needs of other marine life. It also addresses river herring and shad management.
